original: HULTGREN, Oskar Franklin, Direktör, Västervik, f Vvik 25/10 74 av boktr O H o Karolina Eriksson, gm Betzy Åström. Vviks hal 84—90. Anst i typogr.yrket hos C O Ekblad & Co Vvik 90—99, yrkesstudier hos C G Naumann mfl Leipzig 99—00, kont.anst AB P A Norstedt & Söner Sthlm 01—05, Iduns Tryckeri AB Sthlm 05—08, tryckeri-o fabr.förest hos Johnson & Hill, Örebro, 08 —15, tryckeriförest o prok hos C O Ekblad & Co 15—17, vkst dir o styr.led där sed. 18. Resor: Tyskl 14. Medl Publ.kl, Sv Tidn-utg.frn, Odd Fellow. Fma C O Ekblad & Co etabl av boktr C O Ekblad 1834 med bokb C P Björklund som komp 1836 o J E Dahlman som tredje deläg o förest f finans bokh 1855. Efter Ekblads o Dahlmans död 1878 resp 1879 upptogos som komp H:s fader Oscar Hultgren o C F Edholm, vilka båda inneh fman t 15, då Edholm avled. Hultgren ensam inneh t 17, då fman blev ombild t AB m Franklin Hultgren som dir. Fman utg Västerviks-Tidningen (Västerviks Veckoblad), vars första n:r utkom den 19 juli 1834. Fmans bokhandel övertogs 13 av Erik Hultgren under eget f ma n a m n.
translated: HULTGREN, Oskar Franklin, Director, Västervik, born in Vvik on October 25, 1874, son of book printer O H and Karolina Eriksson, married to Betzy Åström. Lived in Vvik from 1884 to 1890. Employed in the printing trade at C O Ekblad & Co in Vvik from 1890 to 1899, received professional training at C G Naumann and others in Leipzig from 1899 to 1900, employed at AB P A Norstedt & Sons in Stockholm from 1901 to 1905, at Iduns Tryckeri AB in Stockholm from 1905 to 1908, served as manager of Johnson & Hill printing house and factory in Örebro from 1908 to 1915, then as manager and associate at C O Ekblad & Co from 1915 to 1917, and has been the company's growth manager and board member since 1918. Travelled to Germany in 1914. Member of Public Club, Swedish Newspaper Publishing Association, Odd Fellow. C O Ekblad & Co book printing company established by book printer C O Ekblad in 1834, with bookbinder C P Björklund as partner in 1836 and J E Dahlman as third co-owner and head of the finance bookstore in 1855. After the deaths of Ekblad and Dahlman in 1878 and 1879, Hultgren's father, Oscar Hultgren, and C F Edholm became partners, both holding shares until 1915, when Edholm passed away. Hultgren became the sole proprietor in 1917, then the company was transformed into AB m Franklin Hultgren with him as director. The company publishes Västerviks-Tidningen (Västerviks Weekly Newspaper), whose first issue was released on July 19, 1834. The company's bookstore was taken over by Erik Hultgren in 1913 under his own name.
